intro: Nephrodium grenadense, commonly known as the Grenada kidney fern, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean island of Grenada. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its fronds are evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Nephrodium grenadense plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
